Subjective: Spot on neck x 2 weeks. Started as small wound post-shaving, also an insect bite in area. Initially thought wart. Lesion is itchy, swollen, redder. Intermittent scabbing/flaking. No pain. No other similar spots. PMH: Warts, ear abscess removal. FH: Paternal family hx of sun-related skin problems, specific dx unknown. Social: Student. Concern: Worried about skin cancer after online search. Request: Wants lesion removed, prefers freezing if an option. Also reports knee pain x months after running, deferred to separate appt.
Objective: Skin: On neck, a single raised, pinkish-red lesion, ~0.5 cm, with a redder center. No visible scab or flaking. Dermoscopy performed. Surrounding skin shows some freckles, no other suspicious lesions. Neck: No cervical lymphadenopathy.
Assessment: Uncertain skin lesion on neck. Differential includes pyogenic granuloma vs. atypical nevus.
Plan:
1. Teledermatology consult: Photo to be sent to dermatologist for opinion.
2. Await dermatologist advice regarding management; discussed potential removal options (cryotherapy, excision, shave biopsy).
3. Follow-up: Will call patient on Friday (before 10 AM or after 3 PM) with dermatologist's recommendation. Voicemail authorized if unavailable.
4. Advised to schedule a separate appointment to address knee pain.
